metadata.Title: CVE-2023-44271 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - low.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in Pillow before 10.0.0. It is a Denial of Service that uncontrollably allocates memory to process a given task, potentially causing a service to crash by having it run out of memory. This occurs for truetype in ImageFont when textlength in an ImageDraw instance operates on a long text argument.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-44271` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

python3-pil - 10.0.0-1
python3-pil.imagetk - 10.0.0-1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> upstream patch adds MAX_STRING_LENGTH which defaults to 1,000,000 limit.

criterions.comment: pillow package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '10.0.0-1').
